data.title: Mad-Libs
data.solution:
statement = input()
n = int(input())
for i in range(n):
    word = input()
    statement = statement.replace('_',word,1)
print(statement)
data.statement: You must insert the given words into the given statement to form a finished Mad-Libs.

testCases.title: Two words
testCases.testIn:
The _ put on his red _.
2
clown
nose
testCases.testOut: The clown put on his red nose.

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
The _ _ over the fence.
2
dog
jumped
testCases.testOut: The dog jumped over the fence.

testCases.title: Many Words
testCases.testIn:
The _ _ sped down the _ in their bright _ car.
4
crazy
driver
highway
red
testCases.testOut: The crazy driver sped down the highway in their bright red car.

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
The _ _ sped down the _ in their _ yellow _.
5
excited
driver
road
bright
taxi
testCases.testOut: The excited driver sped down the road in their bright yellow taxi.

testCases.title: Uppercase Words
testCases.testIn:
_ loved to juggle. _ spent _ practicing.
3
Fred
He
hours
testCases.testOut: Fred loved to juggle. He spent hours practicing.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
_ loves to sing, so _ started a _.
3
Mary
she
band
testCases.testOut: Mary loves to sing, so she started a band.

data.constraints:
All words are in order
No words contain '_'
0 < [[n]] <= 10
The number of '_'s in the statement equals [[n]]
Starting and final statement length <= 255 characters
Each word <= 10 characters
data.stubGenerator:
read statement:string(255)
read n:int
loop n read word:word(10)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<First Line:>> Statement with '_' character wherever a word needs to go
<<Second Line:>> Number of words [[n]]
<<Next >>[[n]]<< Lines:>> Each [[word]]
data.outputDescription: Print the complete statement formed by inserting the words

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must insert the given words into the given statement to form a finished Mad-Libs.
Input
First Line: Statement with '_' character wherever a word needs to go
Second Line: Number of words n
Next n Lines: Each word
Output
Print the complete statement formed by inserting the words
Constraints
All words are in order
No words contain '_'
0 < n <= 10
The number of '_'s in the statement equals n
Starting and final statement length <= 255 characters
Each word <= 10 characters
Example
Input
The _ dog barked.
1
brown
Output
The brown dog barked.
